field.note: If enabled, will send the Notify on Live message to the initiator of the workflow process.
If this option is set, workflow emails will be sent from this email address rather than the email address of the user triggering the workflow changes.
If this option is set, workflow emails will use this email address as their Reply-To address rather than the email address of the user triggering the workflow changes.

When you have the lock for this schema, you can change the order of the workflow by dragging the drag handle (the double-headed arrow button) of a workflow step up and down.
You may only move a step up and down within the same level - ie. you cannot change a top-level workflow step into an escalation step, or vice versa. Available drop points will be highlighted when you start dragging.
If a drag handle does not appear for a step, there is nothing that can be re-ordered. NOTE: The changes you make will not take effect until you commit the screen.
